title: [Large-Scale] Real-Time Online Speaking Proficiency Improvement Program for Secondary English Teachers: Socio-Cultural Context-Integrated Pedagogy and Civicness Cultivation Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary-level English grammar and reading comprehension, basic multicultural education understanding, foundational knowledge of sociocultural contexts (history, geography, political systems), and basic civic education experience
context.additional_context: A practice-oriented design for enhancing practicing teachers' ability to apply instructional strategies in real-world settings. It incorporates interactive learning environments using digital devices, development of teaching materials reflecting sociocultural elements (local communities, global issues), utilization of assessment tools, and emphasizes collaborative activities for fostering citizenship.

learning_goals: Achieve speaking proficiency to explain socio-cultural contexts (history, culture, civic rights) with natural English pronunciation and intonation for ≥10 minutes in real-time online classes.
Demonstrate ≥5 interactive teaching methods to engage students, applying intercultural communication strategies and institutional understanding in classroom simulations.

Trainees can analyze learner performance (3 assignments, 2 team collaborations, 1 final presentation) over eight weeks in a vocational institution’s project-based assessment. They design a 3-tier (beginner-intermediate-advanced) feedback model with a 5-item checklist, pilot it in ≥3 projects, and submit a report integrating ≥3 citizenship elements (collaborative attitude, social responsibility, cultural empathy).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
